column4: is there a better channel for asking package manager specific question?
could you take a loo at this then please http://paste.ubuntu.com/117925/
It's complaining that /etc/init.d/lpd doesn't exist. You could try issuing the following command: sudo touch /etc/init.d/lpd
I manually checked the folder and lpd doesn't exist
I know, hence it complaining. The touch command creates a new, empty file with the name specified.
ah, I did not know that, thanks.
what permissions should I give it?
huh, that's odd. Try chmod 777 /etc/init.d/lpd, then remember to delete the file when the uninstall is done: rm /etc/init.d/lpd
*sigh* Okay, this is gonna require a different approach. Give me a minute.
Do you have the package "cups-bsd" installed? If not, install it.
I know this is weird but what we just did fixed my main problem
Heh. So things are working now? Or do you still have problems?
every time I tried to install updates or anything new, remove old programs etc it couldn't proceed because of the brother printer drivers being in an error state
I think the brother drivers are still bjorked but I can actually do other things with my package manager now
so you fixed my main problem. I'll try and figure the drivers out on my own now, thanks!
